intro: Dubouzetia leionema, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink, which bloom in spring. Dubouzetia leionema is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a shrub that can grow up to 2 meters in height, and its unique foliage makes it a distinctive feature in its native habitat.
